content:
Orlando
 Orlando, the place where pages
from fairy-tales come to life at
Disney's Magic Kingdom, has come
a long way from being a sleepy
Southern farmland to become the
vacation destination for over 45
million people every year. Opening
of Disney's Magic Kingdom may
have created a legacy that has
continued well into the present
with the mushrooming of even
more incredible theme, water and
adventure parks, but the Kingdom
still remains a national shrine, a
visit to which is a rite of passage.
 
 
 
This Pdf and its contents are copyright ©
2013,ixigo.com, all rights reserved. ixigo logo, the
character and all other marks displayed herein are

ixigo.com and/or third parties.
Famous For : Things To DCity
A vital part of the Orlando's economy is
tourism. Apart from being home to Walt
Disney World Resort, theme parks,
adventure activities like hot-air balloon
rides, para sailing and indoor skydiving,
Orlando is a major industrial and hi-tech
centre and is home to the 7th largest
research park in the country. The city is also
one of the busiest American cities for
conferences and conventions.
 
Orlando Travel Guide - http://www.ixigo.com/travel-guide/orlando page 1

What To
 SEE 5 Sights
http://www.ixigo.com/places-to-visit-see-in-orlando-lp-1137034
1 The Wizarding World of Harry
Potter - Only at Universal's
Islands of Adventure


Orlando Travel Guide - http://www.ixigo.com/travel-guide/orlando page 2
 6000 Universal Boulevard, Orlando,
FL 32819-7640
The Wizarding World of Harry Potter
 is an ideal amusement world which
covers two theme parks- Islands of
Adventure and Universal Studios Florida at
the Universal Orlando Resort in Orlando,
Florida. If you are a Harry Potter fan, then
this is a must visit place for you as it will
make to feel into the world of wizard and
magic. Some of the must do things are- take
a ride of
 Harry Potter and The Forbidden
Journey, where you can experience
Hogwarts through the eyes of Harry, try
delicious 
Butter Beer which tastes like cream soda,
walk through the Hogsmeade and
Diagon Alley.Apart from the rides, there are
numerous shops to 
purchase stuff that is mentioned in the
series, restaurants, and other tourist
attractions. Most of them are recreations of
locations in the Harry Potter books while
others have been created specifically for the
park.
2 Universal's Islands of
Adventure
 6000 Universal Blvd.,Orlando
Whether it is a Marvel Superhero World,
Jurassic Park, Reign Of Kong: Skull Island,
Suess Landing for the kids, or The Wizard
World of Harry
Potter, the Universal's Islands
of Adventure has something in store for
people of all age group. From 3-D rides,
Roller Coasters to Water Rides i
t has some of the best rides in the
world. 
The Lost Continent is amazing, and had
moments of real wonder, like the magical
talking fountain. For comic lovers, Marvel
Island is the best spot. You never know
when you might bump
into Wolverine, Rogue, Storm, Spider-
Man and Dr. Doom.
  All in one, its a must visit place for an
entertainment and adventure seeker. Come
here with your friends and family and
unravel another level of adventure.
3 Discovery Cove
 6000 Discovery Cove Way, Orlando,
FL 32821
A topmost attraction for marine life lovers in
Orlando, 
Discovery Cove
 is an amusement park where guests
 can interact with a range of marine animals.
They can play, talk, swim and touch the
dolphins, and the special
bottlenose dolphins. 
Apart from the marine life, the park contains
a free-flight aviary, which has more than 250
tropical birds including parrots, toucans,
and 30 other species of exotic birds. 
The best feature of the park is that there is a
 limit to the amount of people that
can enter this park every day, so as to avoid
congestion. And between all these
adventures, enjoy the fantastic selection of
food and drinks all day long.
4 Disney World Magic Kingdom
 3111 World Drive, Orlando, FL 32830
Make your fantasy come true to reality
at 
Disney World Magic Kingdom,
in Orlando
. Here, you can 
enjoy the thrill of spectacular
rides, light
 show at Cinderella's Castle, 
experience the lives of your favourite Disney
character, click a snap with your favourite
Disney character. Apart from that,
 
Pecos bill is a good place to
eat, scorsorer mickey is a fun
alternative to rides for kids. To avoid the
rush at long queues, you can book tickets
online 30 days before the visit. 
5 Universal Studios Florida


Orlando Travel Guide - http://www.ixigo.com/travel-guide/orlando page 3
 6000 Universal Boulevard, Orlando,
FL 32819-7640
Jump into the action of your favorite
movie/TV show that awaits at the
Universal Studios in Florida. It consists of
two theme parks - Universal Studios Florida
and Islands of
Adventure, an entertainment/n
ightlife complex and five hotels. It also has
a water park under the name Volcano
Bay which is still under construction. The
place demands your whole day to explore
and enjoy most of the rides, movie setups
and much more. And if you need a break,
rush to any of the restaurants within the
park to grab a bite. Now this is what is
known as an ideal holiday destination!
